required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Duloxetine in the Treatment of Fibromyalgia
clinical_study.official_title: A 1-Year Safety Study of Duloxetine in Patients With Fibromyalgia Syndrome

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to evaluate duloxetine for the treatment of fibromyalgia syndrome patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate safety and efficacy of duloxetine in patients diagnosed with fibromyalgia syndrome

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate long-term differences in efficacy in different doses
Evaluate gains in efficacy in non-responders

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Meet criteria for primary fibromyalgia syndrome as defined by the American College of Rheumatologists
Exclusion Criteria:
- Treatment with a monoamine oxidase inhibitor within 14 days prior to Visit 2 or the potential need to take within 5 days after discontinuation from the study.
- Any patients judged by their physicians to be at serious suicidal risk.
- Have uncontrolled narrow-angle glaucoma
